title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.56 - 57 | 4-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौव्रभाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पास्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्रीवास अधी गौव्रभक्त वृन्दा
हरे राम हरे रामा रामरामा हरे हरे ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया नरायनम नमस्कृत्या नरम्चैव नरोत्तमम देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासमततो जयमुदी रयेत।
द्वस्तमाया गुणो दर्को निरुद्ध करणाशयः निवर्तित अखिल आहार आस्ते स्थानुर इवाचलः तस्या अन्तरायो मा इवाभूह।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
सन्यस्ता खिलप कर्मणः आहार।
means what the senses even the senses and this body will also deteriorate as
far as the subtle mind and intelligence are concerned a spiritualist this
identifies from the material mind in the material intelligence and even the
material ego because subtle matter is not exactly like this gross matter which
is destructible in the sense of the term destroying destroying we talk in
terms of something gross and that destruction also what what does it mean
actually everything gross is a combination of the one or more the five
elements earth water fire air sky so destruction means separating all the
elements and returning them to the original
original researcher
are wire of these five elements in the Mahatatva. As I explained the example of the pot in the
previous session, clay pot. The clay pot is formed or produced by combining earth in the
form of clay and water and fire. So clay is first mixed with water and then the pot is
given shape and then it is baked in the fire. So earth, water, fire, three are combined
and the pot is produced by the potter. Now when it is destroyed means fire goes back
to the fire element, water goes back to the water element, the reservoir of water element
and earth, the clay which is earth, nothing but earth, it return, it is returned to the
earthly reservoir. So like that there is no destruction of the mind intelligence and
the false ego because they always exist as subtle elements in this within the gross body
as subtle body, bodily covering. So the yogi he is able to be aloof from the gross body
and the subtle body.
And become completely immune to whatever is happening with the gross and subtle body
without being affected or without worrying what is happening to me because he understands
I am not this body, I am not the gross body, I am not subtle body. It is like your dress.
Supposing the dress has become old and sometimes a worn out dress may tear. So do you think
that, oh!
I am suffering some injury? Just like if there is a something which creates a tear
in your skin, some sharp instrument. Something sharp is spears in your hand, arm and then
there is a cut. So now when you know you are not this body. Supposing there is a cut, now
you have no body.
And then there is a cut. So now when you know you are not this body. So I have seen
Supposing the cloth tears, either it's worn out or it is pierced by some sharp instrument. If the cloth tears, does it mean that something has happened to you or something has happened to your cloth?

If you distinctly know you are different from the cloth, which a matured person, an intelligent person will always be aware of that. I am not this cloth. Then nothing has happened to you when the cloth is torn.
And if it is old and worn out, you discard this cloth and you take a new cloth. Exactly like that the yogi knows.
The body itself is an external covering and it has to be, one has to disidentify, I am not this body, I am spirit soul, spiritual person, personality, apart from the body.
So, the yogic process helps a yogi to completely negate all these material coverings.
The effect of the yogic process is,
the effects of the material modes of nature draw the victim to indefatigable desires of enjoying matter.
This desire for enjoying matter is because of the false identity that I am this body.
If I think I am the body, then my satisfaction is satisfaction of the body.
But if I realize I am not the body, then my happiness is not simply giving satisfaction to the senses, no.
That is not going to make me happy.
So, this false enjoyment by trying to satisfy the senses, external senses, is stopped by the yogic process.
So, then one escapes false enjoyment by following the yogic process.
Every sense is busy searching for its food.
That means eyes are looking for beautiful form, ears are searching for some sweet sound.
Nose is looking for some nice fragrance, nice smell, like that.
The conditioned soul is assaulted on all sides by maya.
Material world is filled with all these different sounds, different forms, different smells, aromas,
different tastes, different tasting type of edibles,
and different types of objects which are very pleasing to the sense of touch.
So, there is no chance to become steady in any pursuit of even searching for some
pleasing sense object.
There is no question of steadiness.
Because always if something beautiful attracts the person due to the beautiful form,
immediately there will be some sound or some smell or some sense of touch.
So, nobody can pursue this.
There is no sense object in a steady way.
Whereas the yogic processes stop this complete pursuit of sense enjoyment
and go within, go within.
That is the actual yogic process.
Now, Maharaj Yudhishtira was advised by his uncle
sorry Maharaj Yudhishtira was advised by Narada
not to disturb his uncle by attempting to bring him back home.
Why? Because Dhritarashtra by practicing the Ashtanga Yoga
he had already become detached from everything material.
So, there will be no more any interest or attraction for Dhritarashtra to come and stay
comfortably with Yudhishtira.
He is beyond that.
Nirguna means without reaction.
The spiritual quality is distinguished from the material qualities by the word nirguna.
Nirguna means the spiritual state where one is indifferent to all material attractions,
all material objects,
all material actions and reactions.
One becomes indifferent, disinterested, completely aloof.
The next verse, 57th verse.
Sava adhyatanadrajan parata panchame ahani
kalevaram hasyati svam tachabhasmi bhavishyati
The meaning of this verse is
O king, he will quit his body most probably on the fifth day from today
and his body will turn to ashes.
So, Narada is telling that Dhritarashtra will perfect his yogic practice
that he becomes detached and after detaching he will quit his body by his own mystic power
and
that mystic power will also enable him to burn the body to ashes,
what he is leaving behind.
The body will be burned to ashes by the self-generated fire by the yogic process itself.
So, perfect yogis, they don't depend on somebody else to burn this body
to dispose of the remnants
after death or after quitting the body.
No, they are able to generate the fire from within to burn the body
and the spirit soul cannot be burned by fire.
The spirit soul will leave the body by mystic power.
So, that is explained here.
So, Yudhishthira need not perform any funeral ceremony for Dhritarashtra
because Dhritarashtra by the yogic process would perfectly be able to leave the body
and also burn the body
at the time of quitting, burn the body by self-generated fire.
These are all very special facilities for the yogi, Ashtanga yogi.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
